Incendiary fires lead bureau investigations in West Harlem

Between 2016 and 2020, there have been a total of 32,519 fires investigated by the Bureau of Fire Investigation across all of New York City,

including 250 fire investigations in Precinct 26 and 246 fire investigations in Precinct 30. Incendiary fires were most prevalent among fires

with a determined cause, defined as “a fire that is intentionally ignited in an area or under circumstances where and when there should not be

a fire” by the National Fire Protection Association. A plurality of fires also fell into the Other category, which include controlled or anticipated

fires, low-count fire categories, or fires that are otherwise unexplained.

Precinct 26

Precinct 30

Incendiary

Incendiary fires lead bureau investigations in West Harlem

Between 2016 and 2020, there have been a total of 32,519 fires investigated by the

Bureau of Fire Investigation across all of New York City, including 250 fire investigations in

Precinct 26 and 246 fire investigations in Precinct 30. Incendiary fires were most prevalent

among fires with a determined cause, defined as “a fire that is intentionally ignited in an area

or under circumstances where and when there should not be a fire” by the National Fire

Protection Association. A plurality of fires also fell into the Other category, which include

controlled or anticipated fires, low-count fire categories, or fires that are otherwise unexplained.

Incendiary fires lead bureau investigations

in West Harlem

Between 2016 and 2020, there have a total of 32,519

fires investigated by the Bureau of Fire Investigations

across all of New York City, including 250 fire

investigations in Precinct 26 and 246 fire investigations

in Precinct 30. Incendiary fires were most prevalent,

which is defined as “a fire that is intentionally ignited

in an area or under circumstances where and when

there should not be a fire” by the National Fire

Protection Association. A plurality of fires fell in the

Other category, which include controlled/anticipated

fires and or is otherwise not explained.
